title: Plants, Food, and Biotechnology
description: Agriculture as applied biology and its impact on civilization. Application of technology to increase the efficiency of food production. Genetics and biotechnology; culminating in an assessment of genetically engineered foods, the myths, the controversy, the science. Not open to CRSC or FRSC majors. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory. Crosslisted as BOT/HCSÂ 329. Fulfills GE Area F.
prerequisites: Completion of one of the following: BIO 111, BIO 114, BIO 161, BOT 121, or HCS 120
